answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The symptom described by you could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. Sometimes the painful sensations can occur prior to herpes (shingles) episode. You may need to consult your primary care physician to detect the cause. In the meantime you can take OTC pain medication Ibuprofen. Ensure to take this medication after food to avoid gastritis.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: I have been experiencing this pain on and off for abt two weeks; dont know what causes it. The nose becomes painful to even the mildest touch. No evidence of sores / pimples (even internal); no bleeds, no nothing! I have so far just willed it to go; apparently it (the pain) is stronger on will power coz it just keeps coming back. The current cycle is over 4 days - the longest yet. I will now have to seek medical advice.  Any thing on offer?
title: Pain  on the tip & side of the nose
